intro: Chaunochiton, commonly known as the sea apple, is a genus of sea slugs belonging to the family Chaunoclitidae. These marine gastropod mollusks are characterized by their soft, fleshy bodies and lack of a shell. They are typically found in shallow coastal waters and are often brightly colored, which may serve as a warning to predators. Chaunochiton species exhibit a range of morphological variations, including different patterns and structures on their bodies. Their ecological role includes contributing to the biodiversity of marine ecosystems and serving as food sources for various marine organisms.
